organic_results.title: Design and substance in educational research: Adolescent attainments, a case in point
organic_results.snippet: Much non-experimental educational research has relied upon cross-sectional designs, while many of the theories which motivate such inquiry imply some sort of developmental sequencing of the relationships of interest. This paper explores the practical implications of this disjuncture between perspective and practice by comparing the conclusions reached in the estimation of a recursive school process model of educational goal formation across several design options. Selecting out appropriate subsets of students from the repeated …
